H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3391.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2779.def: = cold season of the year; also time of plowing; opposite of {L:קַיִץ<SDBH:קַיִץ>}; ≈ sometimes associated with hard work

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H1978.def: literally: step; hence, probably: = the part of the body used for walking

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H2529.def: = coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into {L:cheese<SDBH:חָרִיץ>} or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H6694.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to experience distress, either with words or with actions, ► usually with the purpose of forcing that person to make certain concessions

H6388.def: = a body of flowing water, ◄ probably dug by humans

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7176.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H4186.def: = place where an inanimate object is located, such as the statue of a deity and a town

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2244.def: = process by which liquids become solid, ◄ caused by low temperatures during cold weather

H3453.def: = state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ often associated with wisdom and respectability

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H6113.def: = action by which someone slows down or stops moving forward entirely

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H5057.def: = a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army

H2244.def: = process by which liquids become solid, ◄ caused by low temperatures during cold weather

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

6.gl: (one's) voice hides > to refrain from speaking

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H833.def: literally: to go forward on a road; hence: = to behave in a certain way

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5749.def: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H1293.def: = action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H4598.def: = long garment, hanging down to the ankles, ◄ usually made of wool, ► and worn over the {L:tunic<SDBH:כֻּתֹּנֶת>}; it is not clear whether it had sleeves or not, nor whether it was open or closed in the front; ≈ certain attitudes and emotions are often described in terms of such a garment, e.g. "he wore fury like a robe"

H5787.def: = state in which a person or animal is unable to see

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6455.def: = state in which humans or animals are disabled in one of their legs or feet, ► and so have difficulty walking

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4973.def: used in poetry only: = large, sharp {L:teeth<SDBH:שֵׁן>} of an animal; ≈ associated with aggression

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1478.def: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

H7064.def: = structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2344.def: = minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea-shore, river-beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2919.def: = condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life-enhancing; associated with fertility

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H4456.def: = rain that falls during the first half of April, before the harvest; ► provides the moisture that is crucial for the grains to mature; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH ({A:ABD})

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1416.def: = a group of armed humans equipped for fighting on land, whose main purpose is to execute swift attacks and loot and plunder as much as they can; sometimes also used to denote a unit of a more regular army

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H57.def: = pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
